title: The Piano
brief_description: The piano used in Jane Campion’s award-winning classic dates from 1825–30 and was shipped to the New Zealand from London. Two replicas were made – a lightweight version that could be carried through the bush and one with a steel frame for underwater scenes.

constellations_primary.name: When music speaks
constellations_primary.description: Some characters or moments are expressed more intensely through a musical motif than dialogue or action.

constellations_other.name: Australians on the world stage
constellations_other.description: George Miller’s Mad Max revolutionised movies when it tore through cinemas in 1979. Max Rockatansky’s journey dispensing justice across the wasteland in his V8 Interceptor became a cult classic and catapulted Australian cinema onto the world stage.

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

description:
Music envelops the audience from the first scene of Jane Campion’s The Piano (1993). The acclaimed score by Michael Nyman acts as an extension of Holly Hunter’s character, Ada McGrath. Though Ada never speaks, her treasured piano clearly expresses her emotions, opinions and ideas. Sound defines her character.

The piano itself dates from 1825–30 and was shipped to the New Zealand filming location from London. Two replicas were made – a lightweight version that could be carried through the bush for the opening scene at Karekare beach, and one with a steel frame for underwater scenes.
